Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Andersonin-W1 (AW1, natural AMPs; frog, amphibians, animals, XXU; 1S=S, UCSS1a)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Active against  E. coli (MIC 23.5 ug/ml), C. albicans (MIC 47 ug/ml), S-aureus (MIC >47 ug/ml), and B-pyocyaneus (P. aeruginosa) (MIC >47 ug/ml).wound healing: At relative low concentration of nM, AW1 promoted the proliferation, migration, and scratch repair of keratinocyte, macrophage proliferation, and tube formation of HUVEC.MOA:wound healing: in macrophages, AW1 directly bound to Toll-like receptor 4 (TLR4) in the extracellular region and regulated the downstream nuclear factor-kB (NF-kB) signaling pathway to facilitate the inflammatory factor secretion and suppress excessive inflammation induced by lipopolysaccharide (LPS) (Li et al., 2024).UPdated 7/2021; 2/2024
Literature Information.Author: Yang X, Lee WH, Zhang Y.2011, China, Asia
Literature Information.Reference: J Proteome Res. 2012 Jan 1;11(1):306-19. Epub 2011 Nov 18.PubMed.
Literature Information.Title: Extremely Abundant Antimicrobial Peptides Existed in the Skins of Nine Kinds of Chinese Odorous Frogs
